Title: GPES data for pandemic planning and research COVID-19 (GDPPR)
title_dataset: GPES data for pandemic planning and research COVID-19 (GDPPR)
Description: The GPES Data for Pandemic Planning and Research (GDPPR) dataset was established by NHS England to support the response to the coronavirus outbreak. The dataset is a central collection of GP patient data including the period since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic and a short period of time prior for comparison purposes.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC)
title_dataset: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. Records in the HES Admitted Patient Care (HES APC) database are called ‘hospital episodes’, and each hospital episode relates to a period of care for a patient under a single consultant within one hospital provider. A stay in hospital from admission to discharge is called a ‘spell’ and can be made up of one or more episodes of care.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC) - Other (OTR)
title_dataset: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC) - Other (OTR)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. Records in the HES Admitted Patient Care (HES APC) database are called ‘hospital episodes’, and each hospital episode relates to a period of care for a patient under a single consultant within one hospital provider. A stay in hospital from admission to discharge is called a ‘spell’ and can be made up of one or more episodes of care.
coverage_reason: Please refer to Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) Admitted Patient Care (APC) for approximate coverage.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC) - Augmented Care Period (ACP)
title_dataset: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC) - Augmented Care Period (ACP)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. Records in the HES Admitted Patient Care (APC) database are called ‘hospital episodes’, and each hospital episode relates to a period of care for a patient under a single consultant within one hospital provider. A stay in hospital from admission to discharge is called a ‘spell’ and can be made up of one or more episodes of care. The HES APC Augmented Care Period (ACP) dataset is an extension to the HES APC dataset covering adult critical care. From 2008/2009 onward, the HES APC ACP dataset was replaced by the HES CC dataset.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC) - Maternity (MAT)
title_dataset: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Admitted Patient Care (APC) - Maternity (MAT)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. HES Admitted Patient Care Maternity (HES APC MAT) is a subset of the HES APC dataset which relates to maternity admissions records.
coverage_reason: Please refer to Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) Admitted Patient Care (APC) for approximate coverage.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Accident and Emergency (AE)
title_dataset: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Accident and Emergency (AE)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. HES Accident and Emergency (HES AE) is a record-level dataset of patients attending Accident and Emergency Departments (including minor injury units and walk-in centres) in England. A record represents one attendance.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Accident and Emergency (AE) - Other (OTR)
title_dataset: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Accident and Emergency (AE) - Other (OTR)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. HES Accident and Emergency (HES AE) is a record-level patient dataset of patients attending Accident and Emergency Departments (including minor injury units and walk-in centres) in England. A record represents one attendance.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Critical Care (CC)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. The HES Critical Care (HES CC) dataset is a subset of HES Admitted Patient Care (HES APC) data. It includes record-level patient data of patients admitted for treatment and receiving Critical Care (intensive care or high dependency care) at NHS hospitals in England. A record represents one episode of Critical Care.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Critical Care (CC) - Other (OTR)
title_dataset: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Critical Care (CC) - Other (OTR)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. The HES Critical Care (HES CC) dataset is a subset of HES Admitted Patient Care (HES APC) data. It includes record-level patient data of patients admitted for treatment and receiving Critical Care (intensive care or high dependency care) at NHS hospitals in England. A record represents one episode of Critical Care.
coverage_reason: Please refer to Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) Critical Care (CC) for approximate coverage.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Outpatients (OP)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. HES outpatients (HES OP) is a record-level patient dataset of patients attending outpatient clinics at NHS hospitals in England. A record represents one appointment.

Title: Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) - Outpatients (OP) - Other (OTR)
Description: The Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) datasets contain records of all admissions, appointments and attendances at NHS hospitals in England. HES Outpatients (HES OP) is a record-level patient dataset of patients attending outpatient clinics at NHS hospitals in England. A record represents one appointment.
coverage_reason: Please refer to Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) Outpatients (OP) for approximate coverage.

Title: Secondary Uses Service (SUS)
Description:
The Secondary Uses Service (SUS) is the single, comprehensive repository for healthcare data in England which enables a range of reporting and analyses to support the NHS in the delivery of healthcare services. SUS is a collection of health care data required by hospitals and used for planning healthcare, supporting payments, commissioning policy development and research.

This dataset is no longer updated.

Title: Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data - Admitted Patient Care (APC)
title_dataset: Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data - Admitted Patient Care (APC)
Description: The Secondary Uses Service (SUS) is used to create additional uncurated data sets which offer access to more current, though less complete and assured, data. The Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data Set for Admitted Patient Care is a product provided by SUS.

Title: Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data - Critical Care (CC)
title_dataset: Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data - Critical Care (CC)
Description: The Secondary Uses Service (SUS) is used to create additional uncurated data sets which offer access to more current, though less complete and assured, data. The Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data Set for Critical Care is a product provided by SUS.

Title: Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data - Outpatients (OP)
title_dataset: Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data - Outpatients (OP)
Description: The Secondary Uses Service (SUS) is used to create additional uncurated data sets which offer access to more current, though less complete and assured, data. The Uncurated Low Latency Hospital Data Set for Outpatients is a product provided by SUS.

Title: Emergency Care Data Set (ECDS)
Description: The Emergency Care Data Set (ECDS) is the national dataset for urgent and emergency care. ECDS collects information about why people attend emergency departments and the treatment they receive to improve patient care through better and more consistent information, allow better planning of healthcare services and improve communication between health professionals.

Title: Second Generation Surveillance System (SGSS; Pillar 1 & 2 - positive results only)
title_dataset: Second Generation Surveillance System (SGSS; Pillar 1 & 2 - positive results only)
Description:
The COVID-19 Second Generation Surveillance System (SGSS) includes demographic and diagnostic information concerning antigen test reports for COVID-19 in England. This dataset currently includes the first positive results from Pillar 1 (swab testing in PHE and NHS hospital labs), and Pillar 2 (swab testing in the wider population at drive through test centres, walk-in centres, home kits returned by post etc). Future flows are anticipated to include all positive, negative, void and inconclusive test results.

This dataset is no longer updated.

Title: Pillar 2 Antigen (positive and negative)
title_dataset: COVID-19 antigen testing - Pillar 2 (positive and negative)
Description:
The COVID-19 UK non-hospital antigen testing results (Pillar 2) dataset includes data on antigen swab COVID-19 testing, conducted via drive-through test centres, mobile testing units, satellite test centres, home testing and care home testing. It consists of records from the entire UK, but only English data is provided by default. 

This dataset is no longer updated

Title: Pillar 3 Antibody (positive and negative)
title_dataset: COVID-19 antibody testing - Pillar 3 (positive and negative)
Description:
The COVID-19 UK non-hospital antibody testing results (Pillar 3) dataset, also referred to as iElisa, documents individuals that have undergone a finger prick test for antibodies from having had COVID-19. The dataset is UK-wide and contains positive, negative and void results. It also contains demographic data. Data available is in relation to specified cohorts which differ across geography and time. Data does not include the NHS Antibody tests as NHS Digital does not hold this data.

This dataset is no longer updated.

Title: Variant strain data (COG-UK)
Description: The COVID-19 Genomics UK (COG-UK) consortium has published a dataset which contains over 20K SARS-CoV-2 viral genome sequences available as open access. COG-UK works with the UK Public Health Agencies, Health Data Research UK and other partners to ensure COG-UK SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data is available in a number of trusted research environments to enable accredited researchers to link to externally held datasets

Title: COVID-19 vaccination status
Description: The COVID-19 vaccination status dataset records individual vaccination events, details of the patients, and batch information on the vaccine for anyone vaccinated within England, or those vaccinated in a devolved administration where this information was passed to England.

Title: COVID-19 vaccination adverse reactions
Description: The COVID-19 vaccination adverse reactions dataset includes records relating to patients who have had any adverse reaction to a COVID-19 vaccination, which occurs within the first fifteen minutes after administration of the vaccine. The dataset covers vaccination events in England, or events from devolved administrations where this information was subsequently passed to England.

Title: Civil Registry Deaths
Description: The Civil Registration of Deaths dataset contains details of all registered deaths in England and Wales since 1993, as provided by the ONS. The dataset contains basic demographics of the deceased person, cause of death, records of other diagnoses, which may – or may not – have directly contributed to the death and information about registration itself.

Title: ICNARC COVID
Description: The Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre (ICNARC) COVID-19 dataset covers adult patients (aged 18 years and over) in general critical care units who had a laboratory confirmed COVID-19 case in England since 12th December 2019.

Title: COVID-19 SARI-Watch (formerly CHESS)
Description: Data forming the COVID-19 SARI-Watch dataset (formerly CHESS) relates to demographic, risk factor, treatment and outcome information for patients admitted to hospital with a confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis, as recorded in the COVID-19 SARI-Watch surveillance. Note that SARI-Watch replaced CHESS which was initiated across all NHS Trusts in England on 15 March 2020. SARI-Watch replaced CHESS in summer 2020 and collects the same data items as CHESS, but includes infections other than COVID-19.

Title: NHS BSA Dispensed Medicines
Description: The Medicines Dispensed in Primary Care (NHS BSA) dataset comprises prescriptions for medicines that are dispensed, or supplied, by community pharmacists, appliance contractors and dispensing doctors in England. The data also includes: prescriptions submitted by prescribing doctors for medicines personally administered in England; prescriptions written in England and dispensed outside of England; and prescriptions written in Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland, the Isle of Man, Jersey and Guernsey but dispensed in England

Title: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Administration
title_dataset: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Administration
Description:
Established by NHS Digital in December 2020, the Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (EPMA) dataset is a daily collection of data from electronic prescription and administration systems. This data, relating to medicines prescribed and administered to patients, is sourced from secondary care NHS trusts in England.

This dataset is no longer updated.

Title: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Administration DMD
title_dataset: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Administration DMD
Description:
Established by NHS Digital in December 2020, the Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (EPMA) dataset is a daily collection of data from electronic prescription and administration systems. This data, relating to medicines prescribed and administered to patients, is sourced from secondary care NHS trusts in England.

This dataset is no longer updated.

title_dataset: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Administration Dosage
Description:

This data, relating to medicines prescribed and administered to patients, is sourced from secondary care NHS trusts in England.

title_dataset: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Prescription

Title: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Prescription Chemical
title_dataset: Electronic Prescribing and Medicines Administration (ePMA) - Prescription Chemical
Description:

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - Myocardial Ischaemia National Audit Project (MINAP)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - Myocardial Ischaemia National Audit Project (MINAP)
Description: The Myocardial Ischaemia National Audit Project (MINAP) contains information about the care provided to patients who are admitted to hospital with acute coronary syndromes (heart attack). Data are collected and analysed to illustrate the ‘patient journey’ from a call to the emergency services or their self-presentation at an Emergency Department, through diagnosis and treatment at hospital, to the prescription of preventive medications on discharge.

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Audit of Cardiac Rhthm Management (NACRM)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Audit of Cardiac Rhythm Management (NACRM)
Description: The National Audit of Cardiac Rhythm Management (NACRM) collects information about all implanted cardiac devices and all patients receiving interventional procedures for management of cardiac rhythm disorders in the UK.

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Adult Cardiac Surgery Audit (NACSA)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Adult Cardiac Surgery Audit (NACSA)
Description: The National Adult Cardiac Surgery Audit (NACSA) collects data on all major heart operations carried out in NHS hospitals and a selection of private hospitals throughout the UK. The NACSA collects consecutive operation data from all NHS hospitals in the UK that carry out adult heart surgery. A number of Irish and UK private surgical units also voluntarily submit data.

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Congenital Heart Disease Audit (NCHDA)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Congenital Heart Disease Audit (NCHDA)
Description: The National Congenital Heart Disease Audit (NCHDA) was set up in 2000 to assess patient outcomes after therapeutic paediatric and congenital cardiovascular procedures (surgery, transcatheter and electrophysiological interventions) in the UK and the Republic of Ireland (since 2012).

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Heart Failure Audit (NHFA)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Heart Failure Audit (NHFA)
Description: The National Heart Failure Audit (NHFA) collects data on patients with an unscheduled admission to hospital in England and Wales who are discharged with a primary diagnosis of heart failure. Please note that NHFA v5 has now replaced NHFA.

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Heart Failure Audit Version 5 (NHFA v5)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - National Heart Failure Audit Version 5 (NHFA v5)
Description: The National Heart Failure Audit (NHFA) collects data on patients with an unscheduled admission to hospital in England and Wales who are discharged with a primary diagnosis of heart failure. Please note that NHFA v5 is the new version of NHFA.

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - Percutaneous Coronary Interventions (PCI)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - Percutaneous Coronary Interventions (PCI)
Description: The Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI; also referred to as 'angioplasty') audit collects information about all PCI procedures performed in all NHS hospitals and a selection of private hospitals in the UK.

Title: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - Transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI)
title_dataset: National Institute for Cardiovascular Outcomes Research (NICOR) - Transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI)
Description: The UK Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation (TAVI) registry has collected data about every TAVI procedure performed in the UK.

Title: Sentinel Stroke National Audit Programme (SSNAP)
Description: The Sentinel Stroke National Audit Programme (SSNAP) is a major national healthcare quality improvement programme based in the School of Life Course and Population Sciences at King’s College London.  SSNAP measures the quality and organisation of stroke care in the NHS and is the single source of stroke data in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland. This continuously ascertained, record-level dataset audit collects information on stroke patients in acute hospital, and follows recovery, rehabilitation, and outcomes at the point of 6 month assessment.

Title: National Vascular Registry (NVR)
Description: The National Vascular Registry (NVR) is a national clinical audit commissioned by the Health Quality Improvement Partnership to measure quality of care for patients who undergo vascular surgery in NHS hospitals. The NVR collects data on the five main procedures performed by vascular specialists in the UK: the repair of abdominal aortic aneurysm; carotid endarterectomy; lower limb angioplasty/stenting, lower limb bypass and lower limb amputation for peripheral arterial disease.

Title: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) - Care Activities
title_dataset: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) - Care Activities
Description: The Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) dataset collects information about people in contact with adult psychological therapy services in England. This national dataset has been collected since April 2012 and is a mandatory submission for all NHS funded care, including care delivered by independent sector healthcare providers.

Title: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) - Care Cluster
title_dataset: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) - Care Cluster
Description: The Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) dataset collects information about people in contact with adult psychological therapy services in England. This national dataset has been collected since April 2012 and is a mandatory submission for all NHS funded care, including care delivered by independent sector healthcare providers.

title_dataset: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) - Coded Scored Assessments
Description: The Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) dataset collects information about people in contact with adult psychological therapy services in England. Description: The Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) dataset collects information about people in contact with adult psychological therapy services in England. Description: The Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) dataset collects information about people in contact with adult psychological therapy services in England. Title: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) - Onward Referrals
title_dataset: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) - Onward Referrals
Description: The Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) dataset collects information about people in contact with adult psychological therapy services in England. This national data set has been collected since April 2012 and is a mandatory submission for all NHS funded care, including care delivered by independent sector healthcare providers.

Title: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Baby Demographics
title_dataset: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Baby Demographics
Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

Title: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Baby Diagnoses
title_dataset: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Baby Diagnoses
Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

Title: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Care Activities
title_dataset: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Care Activities
Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

title_dataset: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Demographics Bookings and Pregnancy
Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

title_dataset: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Hospital Provider Spells
Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

Title: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Labour Activities
title_dataset: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Labour Activities
Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

Title: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Maternity Care Plan
title_dataset: Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) - Maternity Care Plan
Description: The Maternity Services Data Set (MSDS) is a patient-level dataset that captures information about activity carried out by Maternity Services relating to a mother and baby(s), from the point of the first booking appointment until mother and baby(s) are discharged from the services.

Title: Mental Health Services Data Set (MHSDS)
Description: The Mental Health Services Data Set (MHSDS) collects data from the health records of individual children, young people and adults who are in contact with mental health services.The MHSDS brings together information captured on clinical systems as part of patient care. It covers not only services provided in hospitals but also outpatient clinics and in the community, where the majority of people in contact with these services are treated.

Title: Mental Health of Children and Young People
title_dataset: Mental Health of Children and Young People
Description: The Mental Health of Children and Young People survey series provides England’s best source of data on trends in child mental health. Major surveys of the mental health of children and young people in England were carried out in 1999, 2004, and 2017. While many surveys use brief tools to screen for nonspecific psychiatric distress or dissatisfaction, this series applied rigorous, detailed and consistent methods to assess for a range of different types of disorder according to International Classification of Disease (ICD-10) diagnostic criteria. All cases were reviewed by clinically-trained raters.

Title: Patient Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs)
Description: The Patient Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs) dataset measures health gain in patients undergoing hip replacement, knee replacement and up to September 2017, varicose vein and groin hernia surgery in England, based on responses to questionnaires before and after surgery.

Title: Primary Care
Description: Scottish Primary Care provided at cluster level.

Title: Outpatient Appointments and Attendances - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR00)
title_dataset: Outpatient Appointments and Attendances - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR00)
Description: The Outpatients (SMR00) dataset collects episode level data from patients on new and follow-up appointments at outpatient clinics in all specialities (except A&E and Genito-Urinary Medicine). An SMR00 is generated for outpatients receiving care in the specialties listed when: they attend a medical consultant outpatient clinic; they meet with a consultant or senior member of his/her team outwith an outpatient clinic session (including the patient's home); they attend a clinic run by a nurse or an AHP identified as the Health Care Professional Responsible for Care for that clinic and who has legal and clinical responsibility for that patient.

Title: General Acute Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR01)
title_dataset: General Acute Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR01)
Description: The General/Acute and Inpatient Day Case dataset (SMR01) collects episode level data on hospital inpatient and day case discharges from acute specialities from hospitals in Scotland. The dataset contains patient identifiers such as name, date of birth, Community Health Index number, NHS number, postcode and ethnicity and episode management data. Of particular interest to researchers would be variables such as where the episode took place, admission type (includes patient injury classifications such as self-inflicted or home accident), waiting times, patients condition (as classified under ICD-10), operations, and discharge location. A wide variety of geographical data is also included in the dataset including Scottish Index of Multiple Deprivation and Carstairs measures, census output area, NHS Board, Electoral Ward and Parliamentary constituency.

Title: Accident & Emergency
Description: The Accident & Emergency (A&E) datamart was established in June 2007 and contains data on patient attendances at Emergency departments, minor injury units and community hospital A&Es across NHS Scotland. In July 2010 the A&E data mart was extended further to collect items such as diagnosis, several injury fields and an alcohol involved flag, which will be used to identify whether the patient’s alcohol consumption was a factor in the attendance. There are two types of data submitted to the A&E datamart: episode and aggregate level data. All hospitals with Emergency Departments submit episode level data containing a detailed record for each patient attendance. Some smaller sites with minor injury units or community hospitals only submit aggregate files containing monthly summary attendance and compliance figures only.

Title: Electronic Communication of Surveillance in Scotland (ECOSS)
title_dataset: Electronic Communication of Surveillance in Scotland (ECOSS)
Description: The Electronic Communication of Surveillance in Scotland (ECOSS) dataset holds all positive microbiology laboratory specimen results and a subset of antimicrobial susceptibility/resistance data in Scotland.
dictionary_reason: This dataset has been archived and we do not currently hold an archived data dictionary

Title: Covid Tests
Description: The Covid Tests dataset started as Electronic Communication of Surveillance in Scotland (ECOSS), a set holding all positive microbiology laboratory specimen results and a subset of antimicrobial susceptibility/resistance data in Scotland. This dataset was archived as of 08-2021 and Covid Tests took over. This newer version includes ECOSS tests, lighthouse results and private lab results.

Title: Variant strain data (COG-UK)
Description: The COVID-19 Genomics UK (COG-UK) consortium has published a dataset which contains over 20K SARS-CoV-2 viral genome sequences available as open access. COG-UK works with the UK Public Health Agencies, Health Data Research UK and other partners to ensure COG-UK SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data is available in a number of trusted research environments to enable accredited researchers to link to externally held datasets.

Title: Vaccination Data
Description: This dataset contains COVID-19 vaccination events in Scotland since December 2020. This includes information such as eligibility cohort, date of vaccination, and vaccination product.

Title: Deaths
Description: This register contains detailed information about each person who has died in Scotland since 1 January 1855.

Title: SICSAG Daily
Description: The Scottish Intensive Care Society Audit Group (SICSAG) has maintained a national database of patients admitted to adult general Intensive Care Units (ICU) in Scotland since 1995. Each line relates to a day of stay in critical care.

Title: SICSAG Episodes
Description: The Scottish Intensive Care Society Audit Group (SICSAG) has maintained a national database of patients admitted to adult general Intensive Care Units (ICU) in Scotland since 1995. Each line relates to a day of stay in critical care.

Title: Prescribing Information System (PIS): Dispensed
Description: The Prescribing Information System (PIS) is the definitive data source for all prescribing relating to all medicines and their costs that are prescribed and dispensed in the community in Scotland. The data covers prescriptions that are prescribed in Scotland by GPs (General Medical Practitioners) and other prescribers (nurses, pharmacists, dentists and allied health professionals) and subsequently dispensed by a community pharmacist, appliance supplier or dispensing doctor anywhere within the UK. Also included are prescriptions written in hospitals that were dispensed in the community. The data includes all medicines, dressings and appliances that were dispensed and reimbursed.

Title: Prescribing Information System (PIS): Prescribed
Description: The Prescribing Information System (PIS) is the definitive data source for all prescribing relating to all medicines and their costs that are prescribed and dispensed in the community in Scotland. The data covers prescriptions that are prescribed in Scotland by GPs (General Medical Practitioners) and other prescribers (nurses, pharmacists, dentists and allied health professionals) and subsequently dispensed by a community pharmacist, appliance supplier or dispensing doctor anywhere within the UK. Also included are prescriptions written in hospitals that were dispensed in the community. The data includes all medicines, dressings and appliances that were dispensed and reimbursed.

Title: Prescribing Information System (PIS): Paid
Description: The Prescribing Information System (PIS) is the definitive data source for all prescribing relating to all medicines and their costs that are prescribed and dispensed in the community in Scotland. The data covers prescriptions that are prescribed in Scotland by GPs (General Medical Practitioners) and other prescribers (nurses, pharmacists, dentists and allied health professionals) and subsequently dispensed by a community pharmacist, appliance supplier or dispensing doctor anywhere within the UK. Also included are prescriptions written in hospitals that were dispensed in the community. The data includes all medicines, dressings and appliances that were dispensed and reimbursed.

Title: ePrescribing
Description: Is this HEPMA?

Title: Scottish Stroke Care Audit (SSCA)
Description: The Scottish Stroke Care Audit (SSCA) checks the quality of stroke care in hospitals in Scotland. The SSCA was established in 2002 and now includes all hospitals managing acute stroke in Scotland.
coverage_reason: This dataset is a registry and coverage is not available.

Title: Diabetes Covariates
Description: The Diabetes Covarites registry combines information from primary and secondary care datasets. The registry presents information on patients registered as having diabetes in Scotland, at both national and health board level. It should be noted that this registry contains only the latest records of many covariates.
coverage_reason: This dataset is a registry and coverage is not available.

Title: Scottish Renal Registry
Description: The Scottish Renal Registry is a national registry which collects and analyses data on patients who have been diagnosed with renal failure and other renal disorders in Scotland.
coverage_reason: This dataset is a registry and coverage is not available.

Title: Maternity Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR02)
title_dataset: Maternity Inpatient and Day Case - Scottish Morbidity Record (SMR02)
Description: The Maternity Inpatient and Day Case dataset (SMR02) collects episode level data every time a mother goes in for an obstetric event (this can be an antenatal, delivery or postnatal episode). A wide range of information is collected including: Mother's age, height, smoking history and previous obstetric history; birth details - induction, analgesia, method of delivery, outcome; and baby's apgar score, sex, gestation, weight.

Title: Welsh Longitudinal General Practice (WLGP)
Description: The Welsh Longitudinal General Practice (WLGP) dataset contains attendance and clinical information for all general practice interactions, including: patients symptoms, investigations, diagnoses, prescribed medication and referrals to tertiary care. This dataset covers 83% of the population of Wales and 80% of GP practices in Wales.

Title: Critical Care Dataset (CCDS)
Description: The Critical Care Dataset (CCDS) is a good supplementary to the hospital inpatient dataset (Patient Episode Dataset for Wales - PEDW). It covers the period of critical care patients received, including the intensity of care (e.g. bed levels, organ support), treatment specialty, and outcome. The dataset contains a critical care specific field giving greater granularity for patients under critical care.

Title: Emergency Department Dataset (EDDS)
Description: The Emergency Department Dataset (EDDS) conatins attendance and clinical information for all NHS Wales Accident and Emergency department attendances. It includes the All Wales Injury Surveillance Systems (AWISS) dataset.

Title: Outpatient Dataset for Wales (OPDW)
Description: The Outpatient Dataset for Wales (OPDW) includes attendance information for all NHS Wales hospital outpatient appointments.

Title: Outpatient Referral Dataset (OPRD)
Description: The Outpatient Referral Dataset (OPRD) includes data on outpatient referrals from primary care. This includes a complete referral pathway to secondary care, including all clinical referrals received from General Practitioner, General Dental Practitioners, Community Dental Services, A&E Departments, self referrals, walk-ins or emergency patients accompanied by a GP letter, and Consultant to Consultant Referrals.

Title: Patient Episode Dataset for Wales (PEDW) - Spells
title_dataset: Patient Episode Dataset for Wales (PEDW) - Spells
Description: The Patient Episode Dataset for Wales (PEDW) contains all inpatient and day case activity undertaken in NHS Wales plus data on Welsh residents treated in English Trusts.

Title: Patient Episode Dataset for Wales (PEDW) - Episodes
title_dataset: Patient Episode Dataset for Wales (PEDW) - Episodes
Description: The Patient Episode Dataset for Wales (PEDW) contains all inpatient and day case activity undertaken in NHS Wales plus data on Welsh residents treated in English Trusts.

Title: COVID-19 Antibody Results
Description: The COVID-19 Antibody Results dataset details tests, outcomes, and some clinically relevant patient information about COVID-19 Tests in Wales.

Title: COVID-19 Test Results (PATD)
Description: The COVID-19 Test Results dataset (PATD) details tests, outcomes, and some clinically relevant patient information about COVID-19 Tests in Wales.

Title: COVID-19 Lateral Flow Test (CVLF)
Description: The COVID-19 Lateral Flow dataset (CVLD) contains data on rapid lateral flow tests used to help to find cases in people who may have no symptoms but are still infectious and can give the virus to others.

Title: COVID-19 Test, Trace & Protect (CTTP)
Description:
The COVID-19 Test, Trace and Protect dataset (CTTP) details the COVID-19 Test, Trace and Protect programme implemented across various parts of the UK. 

This dataset is no longer updated as of 31/05/2024.

Title: COVID-19 Shielded People List (CVSP)
Description: The COVID-19 Shielded People list (CVSP) is a list of high-risk people advised to self-isolate during COVID-19 pandemic. The Chief Medical Officer (CMO) for England, working with the CMOs of the devolved nations and other senior clinicians, commissioned NHS Digital to produce a list of people at “high risk” of complications from COVID-19, who should be shielded for at least 12 weeks. The CMO for Wales commissioned a collaboration of national bodies in Wales (NWIS, DU, NWSSP, PHW) to identify “high risk” people for the Welsh population, based largely on the NHS Digital methodology.

Title: Variant strain data (COG-UK)
Description: The COVID-19 Genomics UK (COG-UK) consortium has published a dataset which contains over 20K SARS-CoV-2 viral genome sequences available as open access. COG-UK works with the UK Public Health Agencies, Health Data Research UK and other partners to ensure COG-UK SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data is available in a number of trusted research environments to enable accredited researchers to link to externally held datasets

Title: COVID-19 Vaccination Dataset (CVVD)
Description: The COVID-19 Vaccination Dataset (CVVD) covers all patients and vaccinations administered or planned for COVID-19, in or funded by the NHS. The dataset is de-identified record-level data of people who have received a vaccination for COVID-19, including details of the type of vaccine and date of vaccination.

Title: Annual District Death Extract (ADDE)
Description: The Annual District Death Extract (ADDE) is a register of all deaths relating to Welsh residents, including those that died outside of Wales.

Title: COVID-19 Consolidated Deaths (CDDS)
Description: The COVID-19 Consolidated Deaths Dataset (CDDS) is similar to the usual Annual District Deaths Dataset, except this dataset contains additional information with relevance to deaths where COVID-19 is attributable.

Title: Intensive Care National Audit and Research Centre (ICNC)
title_dataset: Intensive Care National Audit and Research Centre (ICNC)
Dataset: Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre
dataset_dataset: Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre
Description:
The Intensive Care National Audit and Research Centre (ICNC) is a dataset of intensive care case mix and activity. It includes information preceding admission to intensive care e.g. date of hospital admission, and information about min and max values of critical indicator (e.g. lowest heart rate, highest serum glucose). 

This dataset is no longer updated.

Title: Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre (Covid-19 Admissions Only)
title_dataset: Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre (Covid-19 Admissions Only)
Dataset: Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre (Covid-19 Admissions Only)
dataset_dataset: Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre (Covid-19 Admissions Only)
Description:
The Intensive Care National Audit and Research Centre is a dataset of intensive care case mix and activity; this is the weekly COVID-19 only version of the dataset (ICCD). It includes information preceding admission to intensive care e.g. date of hospital admission, and information about min and max values of critical indicator (e.g. lowest heart rate, highest serum glucose).

This dataset is no longer updated.

Title: Wales Dispensing Dataset (WDDS)
Description:
The Welsh Dispensing Dataset (WDDS) covers prescriptions that are prescribed in Wales by GPs and non-medical prescribers that have prescribed on behalf of the GP practice, that are then dispensed in the community within Wales. The data includes all prescribed medicines, dressings and appliances that are dispensed each month. If a patient does not take a prescription to the pharmacy for dispensing, then the information will not be included in the dataset. Information includes - the number of prescription items dispensed by each community pharmacy in Wales, broken down by the GP practice in which they prescribed, and also the number of prescription items prescribed in each GP practice in Wales broken down by the pharmacy that dispensed those items.

This dataset is no longer updated.

Title: HQIP Stroke Audit (pending approvals)
Description: This continuously ascertained, record-level dataset audit collects information on stroke patients in England, Wales and Northern Ireland in acute hospital, and follows recovery, rehabilitation, and outcomes at the point of 6 month assessment.

Title: Annual District Birth Extract (ADBE)
Description: The Annual District Birth Extract (ADBE) comprises all live and stillbirths registered in Wales between 1996 and 2018, as provided by the Office for National Statistics. They include information about place of birth, birth weight and place of birth of parents

Title: Care Home Dataset (CARE)
Description: The Care Home Dataset (CARE) contains residential and geographical information data about care homes in Wales.

Title: Maternity Indicators Dataset (MIDS) - Birth
Description: The Maternity Indicators Dataset (MIDS) captures data relating to the woman at initial assessment and to mother and baby (or babies) for all births. This relates to initial assessment and birth activity undertaken in Wales only.

Title: Maternity Indicators Dataset (MIDS) - Initial Assessment
Description: The Maternity Indicators Dataset (MIDS) captures data relating to the woman at initial assessment and to mother and baby (or babies) for all births. This relates to initial assessment and birth activity undertaken in Wales only.

Title: Congenital Anomaly Register (CARS)
Description: The Congenital Anomaly Register and Information Service (CARS) contains information about any foetus or baby who has or is suspected of having a congenital anomaly and whose mother is normally resident in Wales at time of birth. It includes babies in whom anomalies are diagnosed at any time from conception to the end of the first year of life. Data collection commenced on 1st January 1998 and includes any baby where pregnancy ended after this date.

Title: National Community Child Health (NCCHD)
Description: The National Community Child Health Database (NCCHD) includes birth registration and monitoring of child health examinations and immunisations. The dataset brings together data from local Child Health System databases which are held by NHS Trusts and used by them to administer child immunisation and health surveillance programmes. The dataset contains all children born, resident or treated in Wales and born after 1987.

Title: ONS 2011 Census Wales (CENW)
Description: A census in the UK is a count of all people and households. This census was held on 27 March 2011. All 2011 Census data for ‘Welsh’ records are defined as those: Currently resident in Wales; With a second address in Wales; With a previous years address in Wales; With a term-time address in Wales; Who work in Wales (but live in England); In Armed Forces Establishments in Wales; Who are visitors in Wales; Who are Welsh language speakers (including those who live and work outside of Wales).

Title: Referral to Treatment Times (RTTD)
Description: The Referral to Treatment Times dataset (RTTD) contains information on the total time waited from referral by a GP or other medical practitioner to hospital treatment in the NHS.

Title: SAIL Dementia e-Cohort (SDEC)
Description: The SAIL Dementia e-Cohort (SDEC) dataset is a population-based electronic cohort containing health-related information on people with and without diagnosed dementia. By applying coding algorithms to linked routinely-collected datasets, a novel Dementia Platform UK (DPUK) cohort was developed to maximise generalisability and utility for a broad range of research questions and methodologies. It aims to minimise duplication of effort, increase reproducibility, reduce costs, and allow a broader range of researchers to apply to use SAIL data.

Title: Welsh Ambulance Service Dataset (WASD)
Description: The Welsh Ambulance Services NHS Trust data covers data pertaining to more than 250,000 emergency calls a year, over 50,000 urgent calls and transport over 1.3 million non-emergency patients to over 200 treatment centres throughout England and Wales. The ambulance services statistics show monthly data for Wales on the number of calls and the time taken to respond to an incident.

Title: Welsh Results Reporting Service (WRRS)
Description: The Welsh Results Reporting Service (WRRS) allows health care professionals across Wales to access laboratory results for pathology requests and any other associated results across all health boards in Wales, wherever they had their test taken.

Title: Welsh Demographic Service Dataset (WDSD)
Description: The Welsh Demographic Service Dataset (WDSD) is a register of all individuals registered with a Welsh GP, includes individuals anonymised address and practice history.
